full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 734-8 Filed 07/15/22 Page 10 of 13
Probate ST-19-PB-0080 171
1 program, quote, contains no assurances that
2 the information submitted by a claimant cannot
3 be later used against her if she thereafter
4 decides to file suit against the estate or any
5 other co-defendant.
6
7 Is that criticism grounded in
8 the way you see the program?
9 A. No. No. The protocol expressly
10 secures the confidentiality of anything
11 provided by the claimant. The claimant, and
12 the claimant alone, decides the extent of
13 transparency or disclosure - not the program,
14 not the administrator, or the estate.
15 Q. A few more, on Page 6, there's a
16 concern that notes, quote, the program
17 provides no protection to claimants who
18 voluntarily provide information that may later
19 be used to defend the estate from claims or
20 provides evidence against other victims. Does
21 the program work that way?
22 A. No. The program seals all the
23 information and various common law and
24 statutorial privileges apply. We've seen that
25 in these other programs - attorney-client,
etcetera; settlement discussions, etcetera.
DOJ-OGR-00011515

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript or deposition related to a legal case involving an estate and claimants. The text is typed, and there are no visible handwritten notes or stamps. The document is well-formatted and legible.
